content: op knit by susan ashcroft yarn you can use fingering sport or dk you can also combine 2 weights allow at least 150m/165yds of each of two contrasting yarns you get interesting effects if one of the yarns is striping or variegated be sure there is contrast with all of the colours for variegated yarns you could also use 3 or 6 separate ccs you need good contrast between the mc and the cc - if you are not sure if your yarns have enough contrast knit some 2-row stripes in stockinette to check brooklyn tweed arbor + noro flower bed on the left mustard and teal versions handspun on the right all on 4 5mm/us 7 suggested needle size/gauge 4 5mm/us 7 check that your gauge is approx 20-21sts per 4 /10cm but it s not critical you ll just get a slightly you can find more yarn ideas and projects snugger or looser cowl linked to the pattern page on ravelry link size approx 55cm/22 around supplies 1 stitch marker abbreviations k = knit p = purl st s = stitch es sl = slip purlwise with yarn in back pw wyib = purlwise with yarn in back mc = main colour cc = contrast colour kitchenering see pg 2 for details © ashcroft-hempsall 2020 - for personal non-commercial use only op knit 2 there are 2 versions both can be made using the chart pg 3 or written instructions pg 4 provisional cast-on and kitchener the advantage of this option is that you get a seamless loop that you can rotate to display the colours you like miriamspooner cable cast-on and purl edge you will be able to fold the cowl in half and have 2 different sides fewer options for wear but no kitchenering stitchnerd version 1 provisional cast-on + kitchener use a smooth yarn and make a crochet chain with at least 120 sts pick up 120 sts in the chain using the mc the mc can be light or dark work from the chart or written instructions if your mc is dark start with round 2 if your mc is light start with round 20 at the end of the round place the marker and join to work in the round continue to work from the chart or written version work 6 bands stopping after round 36 for dark mc round 18 for light mc then kitchener together see photo on page 1 version 2 cable cast-on + purl edge cast on 120 sts using cable cast on + your mc can be light or dark link for cable cast-on http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable-cast-on html purl 1 row with mc and then place the marker and join to work in the round work from the chart or written instructions if your mc is dark start with round 1 if your mc is light start with round 19 continue to work from the chart or written version work 6 bands stopping after round 36 for
